intro: Eritrichium jenisseense var. coronatum, commonly known as the Siberian crown eritrichium, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Siberia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered, violet or blue-purple flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, alpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
